Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: DreamTeam continues its open-source strategy by releasing a fixed hourly rate smart contract DApp. 🛡️Trickle, a blockchain application that lets two parties create secure fixed hourly rate agreements, locks the reward for the recipient and releases it in a linear proportional to time. Follow Trickle updates by subscribing to its repository here 👉http://bit.ly/2WeKFBv.

Manis will be focused on Apex Legends and its competitive direction. For more information on EA PLAY, feel free to take a look at our blog post 👉http://bit.ly/2WzhQPT on what we expect to see and hear at the event.

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Hello! Thank you for taking interest in our platform. The blockchain technology is applied on the DreamTeam platform via smart contracts that ensure contract execution and payouts according to the preset conditions. Smart-contracts protect all arrangements from retroactive changes. By using them on DreamTeam, we can guarantee payments of promised sums to the players or teams and fulfillment of all undertaken obligations to the tournament organizers and sponsors.

Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

On top of all that, we’ll follow Apex’s evolution as an esport and keep the gamers updated on the pro scene.

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: DreamTeam: the One Team Bringing the eSports Dream to Life  eSports has revolutionized the way in which the world views and digests video games. To the average sports fan, it may seem a bit bizarre to enter a 20,000 person stadium just to watch gamers around the world battle it out on massive screens. But for gamers, the ascension of eSports has provided a platform in which to globally showcase their world-class gaming skills.  DreamTeam is an online platform designed for eSports gamers and managers looking to find teammates, earn an income via global competitions and sponsorships, hone their skills, and manage remote teams. In other words, it's a one-stop, robust organizational tool for eSports community members to collaborate more effectively.  Read the details in the article of Coinidol dot com, the world blockchain news outlet: https://coinidol.com/dreamteam-bringing-esports/

Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

A surge in fraudulent ICOs 3.  The increased scrutiny that each coin goes through  We apologize for the delay and will continue to provide as much information as we can in order to alleviate any of your concerns.

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Hello! DreamTeam - infrastructure platform and payment gateway for esports and gaming. DreamTeam is the ultimate teambuilding and skill-growing platform that solves problems for hundreds of millions of gamers who want to build, grow, manage and monetize their teams. The team owners can search for and find new players of different rank, manage teams through a variety of tools.  And with the unlocking of blockchain and smart contract technologies, DreamTeam is building a one-of-a-kind payment gateway for players, teams, tournaments and sponsors. Shortly the players will be able to pay their  teammates salaries through the DreamTeam Token as well as find and sign sponsorships & media right sales, get their prize money payouts and compensation for gaming, and earn more through other numerous monetization options.

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Prize money payouts, players salaries, transfer market, advertisement and sponsorship fees, media right sales and crowdfunding - everything will be paid out securely and transparently via DreamTeam Tokens. The DreamTeam Token is the one and only platform currency, which may be used to pay for any service starting from premium-accounts to all types of smart contracts (sponsor payments, tournaments prize money, players salaries, players purchases and sells).

Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Hello! We use PostgreSQL 9.5. PostgreSQL is an enterprise-grade, highly scalable, optimized database that creates well running query plans, making it very responsive. We also use NOSQL Databases such as MongoDB in different parts of the system, where it makes sense for us to use it, instead of relying on relational database for every functionality. All of the technological stack runs on AWS Infrastructure with Docker containers, Kubernetes orchestration, and a CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous deployment) infrastructure is in place. We have done performance testing using the Gatling tool and we are constantly optimizing our code, our queries and our infrastructure to handle the expected loads of the systems for years to come.  More information you can find here: https://token.dreamteam.gg/documents/DreamTeam_Whitepaper_ENG.pdf

Author: lolobit
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: ICO Analysis: DreamTeam on April 6, 2018 By Alex Moskov  Verdict DreamTeam is targeting a large and growing industry with a suite of blockchain-backed products. Providing payment channels, business tools, and advertising capabilities, the project has it all. While other projects, like Enjin Coin, are focusing on a specific aspect of gaming, virtual goods ownership, DreamTeam seems to be throwing spaghetti at the wall to see what sticks. If one of their features strikes a chord with the community, though, the strategy pays off. However, spreading themselves so thin may just lead to a bunch of half-baked offerings.  Risks     Poor token distribution. With only a 60% distribution to ICO contributors, the project is far from decentralized. The 15% payout to pro-teams and tournament organizers is also a little worrisome. (-4)     Lack of product focus. The team is trying to make the platform into an all-in-one solution for the esports industry. It’s almost always better for projects to focus on one problem and grow from there. (-3)  Growth Potential     Growing market. The esports market is booming and is showing no signs of slowing down. If DreamTeam can solidify themselves as the platform for teams and organizers, the sky’s the limit. (+3)     Rockstar team. From the co-founders to the advisors, the team is fully plugged into the target market. Partnerships with ESL and Na’Vi go a long way. (+6)     Early traction. Getting early traction is one of the most important signs of a successful project. The platform, in beta, already has 120 thousand registered users and 20 thousand registered teams. (+5)  Disposition DreamTeam scores a respectable 7 out of 10. Although I disagree with the overall product strategy, the numbers speak for themselves. Even though the project is only in beta, the team has proven that there’s ample demand. If the user base continues to grow at the same impressive rate and the platform can retain those already on it, DreamTeam should see a large amount of success. With the pedigree of the team behind the curtains, I don’t think this would surprise anyone.  Proof: https://hacked.com/dreamteam/

Body: Please, comment this, as I know the project include the fact that the founders of the Dream Team take part simultaneously in two ICOs. In addition to creating a platform for the formation of cybersport teams, they are also the founders of a platform for trading of virtual goods DMarket. The presence of two projects at once creates significant risks of insufficient concentration of efforts and the attention of the founders for the full implementation of the Dream Team, which reduces the likelihood of generating a successful return of funds to investors.  Is it a negative factor of this ICO?

Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

From today (until February 25) starts the official play-off phase. Professional players and teams battle with each other for the prize-pool of $300,000! If you want to see for yourself what the real esports looks like, you can tune into the live broadcast. Just following the link: https://www.twitch.tv/starladder5

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: DreamTeam is proud to present the first DreamTeam CS:GO Infographics, where we showcase our platform success and latest data points. Just imagine that in less than 4 months over 300K users registered with 47K+ teams actively searching for players to join them and play competitively. At the same time over 141K players are looking for teams to join. 40% of users are newbies, 56% are semi-pro, and 4% play CS:GO professionally. 50% of users want to become pro, 27% play in amateur leagues and 22% play CS:GO for fun. That’s amazing news as our goal of opening the esports to the general public is coming true. Follow the link to see full stats: http://bit.ly/2Fx8uJk

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

After the conference, they did not miss the opportunity to pay a visit to the DreamTeam office, where they shared their industry insights and got to know about our infrastructure platform and universal payment system for gaming and esports!

Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: We're two separate companies with different ideas and products. Alexander Kokhanovskyy is the Founder of DreamTeam, and Volodymyr Panchenko is a minority shareholder who is only taking care of strategic planning and advising on Machine learning and AI. The teams, consisting of over 30 specialists each, work separately, and the only specialist involved in both projects is Andrey Khavruchenko, the blockchain architect.

Author: hollybit
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: No, I meant, will it be necessary to indicate your real name in the profile? Or you can get by just with a nickname?

Author: Ackedy
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: As a rule, the employer makes an investigation of you, and is interested in your performance on the last job. If you were known by nick – no problem. But at the same time, you will have to disclose your real name when sending a CV.

Author: hollybit
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

Author: bittcrypt
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: I do not know where you heard this, but CS: GO will appear on the platform as the first, MOBA-games will only follow it. I think this decision is incredibly logical, in view of the fact that finding players in shooters is much easier.

Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: There are several classes in shooters, but there are not so many heroes used in different positions. At the dawn of the project you need to do something less complex, attract the audience, and only then think about expanding. I think that all the holders of the tokens will support me.

Author: hollybit
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Good afternoon. I believe that in view of the availability of commissions, your platform will be absolutely uninteresting to sports clubs seeking to find themselves in cybersport. What can you say about this?

Author: Ackedy
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: I do not quite understand what prompted you to draw such a conclusion. Today the Commission is presented everywhere and this is normal, because even non-profit organizations need to function and pay salaries.

Author: hollybit
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Look, if you sign the compositions directly, then there is no need to pay any commission fees, only salary to the players and nothing more.

Author: Ackedy
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Yes, at the time of signing, there are no additional expenditures, but you completely forget about the need to search for this composition itself. On DreamTeam, the club will be able to view the rating, highlight the most promising compositions from their point of view and check in practice.

Author: Immer
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: You only talk about signing young teams, but to maintain prestige, many sports clubs will need to take experienced fighters, right?

Author: Ackedy
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: The platform is perfect for experienced teams. Given the current instability and lack of clear transition norms, the teams often remain without sponsors, and this is an excellent opportunity for their signing by the clubs.

Author: energycrypt
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: DreamTeam cooperates with top-level Esports brands, and since our launch, in October we’ve already signed agreements with such giants as ESL - the world’s #1 Esports company and biggest tournament organizer, and Starladder - one of the biggest tournament organizers and a platform for amateur and semi-professional gamers. Also by signing agreements with the best Esports teams, DreamTeam can reach more Esports fans and build up its user base. Natus Vincere (NaVi), one of the most popular and successful Esports teams on the planet, was the first pro-team to partner up with DreamTeam. We aim to add more high-profile esports brand partners to create a strong community based on the DreamTeam platform. This week we’ll be announcing even more partners, and a top-level team is among them!

Author: Shaurman
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: If the tokens are the only stumbling block, nobody will leave the platform. Here's another example: the German sold the product for the deutsche mark until 2004, and from 2005 he already sells them for Euros. Did he close the store? Or did those who had only deutsche mark, or only Euros, ceased to use is services? Of course, not. I believe that the platform will provide everyone with quality tools for management in the field of cybersports, and the rest is a matter of time.

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: At the the moment  there is no system of managing cybersport teams at all. We are the first ones to create it from the very beginning. We have beeen negotiating regarding sponsorship packages and media-rights with numerious platforms, and they all have agreed to participate. Since this is really very convenient to review and choose when everything is located in one place as a marketplace. With the help of the contracts it is also transparent for all sides. We wll notify everyone once we officially sign all agreements. Every month we participate in conferences all around the World,  increasing the interest in our platform at the same time.  You may check the whole list of conferences by this link - https://token.dreamteam.gg/#contacts. Among our partners we can already name  ESL, Star Ladderand NaVi.

Author: thesloobjohnb
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Also : "On the page #29, a question is asked: Is the company’s legal structure transparent? The DreamTeam company’s legal structure adheres to all relevant legal norms and is fully transparent. All appropriate documents regarding the ownership transparency can be found on the DreamTeam website."  I must admit that @Jacob70 makes a very good point and it does appear that these three guys are running two ICOs back to back. This does reek of a scam, but there are ways to dispel rumors of fraud. A co-founder and board member of a start-up company who is not active in day-to-day operations is a strange thing indeed, but not out of the realm of possibility. If DreamTeam and Dmarket are truly interested in assuring that their "company’s legal structure adheres to all relevant legal norms and is fully transparent" please show us where we can view the articles of incorporation and other company founding documents for both companies. Taking your word for it and trusting your white paper is not sufficiently transparent. Thank you.

Author: Jacob70
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Everyone should be aware of this ICO DreamTeam and to think carefully before investing:  This is Dmarket’s main team as listed on their official website https://dmarket.io/     Now check DreamTeam website: https://token.dreamteam.gg/     Please explain this? Why do you have the same team on both ICOs websites, and now you changed the date from 6 days apart to 30 days apart so no one notices? Running 2 ICOs from the same team with hardcap of over 100 million is very odd and I think your potential investors should know this.  Why would you run 2 ICOs at the same time from the exact same team? Not logical explanation apart from trying to extract as much money from people who are not aware of this. Not good, shame! You should complete the road map for one of your ICO (which one are you focusing on?) before starting another ICO!

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Dear Digrate editorial team,  DreamTeam highly values all input and reviews provided by the third parties even if some information in them may be misleading or even false. In this instance, Digrate.com posted a review of the DreamTeam platform and rated DreamTeam as a B1 investment with considerable risk exposure and high sensitivity to market conditions. We strongly disagree with such a ranking and reviews of other well-respected portals support our claim:  - icobench.com gave the DreamTeam ICO profile a 5.0 mark with an overall score of 4.2 - tokentops.com expert praised the DreamTeam and gave the overall mark of 4.5 stars - icorating.com gave DreamTeam a high Invest score and low Risk score.  All of the above rankings regard DreamTeam highly both in investment perspectives and esports development potential.  Let’s address all Digrate.com concerns one-by-one:  On the page #11, a question is asked: Does the problem the project plans to solve really exist? DreamTeam strongly believes that such a problem does really exist for 250-300M players worldwide, according to the Newzoo Global Esports Market Report. Right now no all-in-one platform offers a comprehensive list of tools and utilities to kick-start an esports career. We are faced with a multi-million audience that is stuck in development as there is no simple and effective solution that can solve their pains without spending thousands of dollars and weeks of time to establish a team and gather players of similar skill level.  On the page #14, a question is asked: Does the company understand its competition? Well, we’ve actually done a thorough analysis of DreamTeam competition. DreamTeam Crew has many years of hands-on experience in esports, and in our opinion, eSports.com and Eloplay are not our competitors by any margin. Drawing from our experience and having gathered an Advisory Board and Partners who have been working with various gaming and esports sub-industries, we are fully aware of all available options out there and how the esports industry is stagnating because of their incomprehensiveness. Our CEO, Alexander Kokhanovskyy, has 17 years of experience in the Esports industry; created one of the most popular teams in the history of Esports – Natus Vincere (Na`Vi); shareholder of ESForce, the 3rd biggest Esports entity funded by the USM Holdings. He worked his way up from an amateur player to a pro who represented his country on the international level on the world championship (World Cyber Games). Being a seasoned esports player, he utilizes all of his experience to solve actual esports problems and help it become on par with regular sports   On the page #17, a question is asked:  Is blockchain technology a solution to the market problem? We firmly believe that all the information available on our platform should be secure and visible to everyone, and cannot be altered. All of this can be done only through utilizing the blockchain technology and smart-contracts. This way DreamTeam can ensure that when third parties sign contracts, every participant obliges to the terms written down in it. Without the blockchain technology, smart-contracts are impossible to implement. Smart-contracts protect all the arrangements from retroactive changes. By using them on DreamTeam, we can guarantee payments of promised sums to the players and fulfillment of all undertaken obligations to the tournament organizers and sponsors. A big issue is players’ salaries and tournament prize money payouts. This is a major irritation point even for those who were able to find time, money and go through the hurdles of creating a team on their own. There is too much fraud even at the professional level, more so for the amateurs. It’s often the case that tournament prize payouts are delayed up to six months, and salaries are not paid according to contracts. DreamTeam addresses these issues and will develop a wide range of services that function using smart contracts to ensure zero fraud, timely payouts, and secure financial operations management.  For example, teams can set their KPI’s for the team manager and team coach, and they, in turn, set personal KPI’s for each player. Then, after a period of time (e.g., after a month), everyone is auto-checked by smart contracts and depending on the results, all participants of the process receive their salary and bonuses. The same goes for tournament prize payout, a smart contract is signed before the tournament start, and after the tournament and every team will immediately receive a payment according to their placement results. DreamTeam smart-contract, therefore, provide limitless opportunities for a variety of spheres. With unlocking of blockchain and smart contracts technologies, we have a unique opportunity to build one-of-a-kind platform and payment gateway for players, teams, tournaments, and sponsors.   On the page #20, a question is asked: Is there already a working product that can be sold to customers? The DreamTeam Beta platform went live in October and we’ve already reached a 1 user per minute registration rate. There have been over 20,000 registrations in two weeks since the launch and players are very active in the process of creating and joining CS:GO teams on DreamTeam.  On the page #24, a question is asked: Is the issuance of tokens limited? According to the Legal Token Sale Agreement found on our website the issuance of tokens is limited: “The Seller will issue the amount of DreamTeam Tokens equivalent to $45,000,000. If the Seller will not sale all issued DreamTeam Tokens during the Sale Period, then all the rest that remain will be burned out.”  DreamTeam has the first presale and sale soft cap of $2M and a hard cap of $6M. The overall cap was lowered from $75M to $45M, and all unsold tokens are burned. Therefore DreamTeam issues a limited number of tokens.  On the page #29, a question is asked: Is the company’s legal structure transparent? The DreamTeam company’s legal structure adheres to all relevant legal norms and is fully transparent. All appropriate documents regarding the ownership transparency can be found on the DreamTeam website.  On the page #31, a question is asked: Has the company taken preventive measures to avoid problems with ICO market regulators? As answered in the above question, we cooperate with top law firms that consult such giants as Apple, Facebook, Google, and eBay to avoid any complications with ICO market regulations. We structure our token not as a security, swap, futures or forward, but as a utility token - meaning commodity.  On the page #34, a question is asked: Is the project popular on social networks and in thematic communities? At this point in time, we are mostly focused on developing our platform, which is key as we want to offer the best experiences for players on a very tight schedule. According to Similarweb open data source have neared the 1M visits per month. Please follow the link https://imgur.com/a/lXQWp for Similar Web stats.  As for our social media presence, thousands of users have flocked to them already and follow DreamTeam news and weekly updates. Many more have signed up for our newsletter where we discuss the latest developments in DreamTeam. We are confident that as our platform grows more and more people will naturally flow to our social media pages to discuss latest esports news and more.   On the page #36, a question is asked: Is the project widely discussed in blockchain news resources? DreamTeam Crew received a prestigious “Blockchain Best Industry Application Award” at the Global Fintech & Blockchain China Summit 2017 and received high praises from the Organizing Committee of the Award for the breakthrough application of blockchain and smart-contracts technologies in Esports market development. Our platform has been noted on many specialized blockchain news resources and prominent media outlets such as CoinSchedule, CoinSpeaker, Forbes and more. Please consult the below list of publications for in-depth reading.  https://www.coinschedule.com/blog/how-one-man-is-changing-the-esports-industry/ https://www.coinspeaker.com/2017/11/09/blockchain-based-dreamteam-app-aims-shake-whole-esports-industry/ https://blog.icoalert.com/ico-alert-report-dreamteam-3a84425a43f7 https://icowatchlist.com/blog/dreamteam-invest-in-esports-industry/ http://bitcoinist.com/dreamteam-creates-the-first-and-largest-recruitment-and-management-network-for-esports-players/ https://www.forbes.com/sites/outofasia/2017/11/07/how-cryptocurrencies-and-blockchain-are-taking-esports-to-the-next-level/#b0a85b543912  On the page #43, a question is asked: Does the project have a strong advisory board? We are constantly updating the list of our advisers and partners and publicize their addition to the DreamTeam Advisory Board and Partners List. Please consult our Whitepaper for the up-to-date and Medium blog for the official press-releases. We will continue to add high-level professionals and consultants from different spheres and will have the strongest Advisory Board compared to any other gaming/crypto ICO ever. As of now, the DreamTeam Board was joined by:  Moe Levin – CEO of Keynote Sundance Digiovanni – former CEO and Co-Founder of MLG, VP content and media in Blizzard Kim Rom – an Esports and gaming veteran, and former CMO at SteelSeries and Chief Gaming officer at Kinguin.  On the page #44, a question is asked: Are the project’s partners large and well-known? In the last weeks, we’ve have announced several large and well-known partners that are in their essence the most significant esports entities in the world. As of now, the DreamTeam Partners are:  ESL - the world #1 Esports company and the biggest tournament organizer Starladder - one of the biggest tournament organizer, platform for amateur and semi-professional gamers Natus Vincere (Na`Vi) - one of the most popular and one of the most successful Esports teams on the planet.  On the page #46, a question is asked: Is the project attracting large VC investors? This is not a relevant characteristics, and it seems the Digrate team was unable to grasp the DreamTeam investment idea fully. Our investment model does not correspond with the idea of attracting VC money. Currently, DreamTeam leadership is financing the platform development out of their own pocket. Moreover, we receive dozens of requests at conferences and even more emails and calls from people who want to buy out the DreamTeam share in the project. But we have a different financing model and have set up a dedicated token sale for all interested parties to join in December. Through the token sale, DreamTeam offers a large swath of opportunities for token buyers from all over the world who want to partake in the development of the greatest all-in-one esports platform. We are keen to ensure that the esports community isn’t passive on the issue of its development perspectives but has a vote in the creation of a uniform esports eco-system.

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Hi there! DreamTeam is a separate entity led by Alexander Kokhanovskyy. He is also a minority shareholder of DMarket but he is not involved operationally. There are two separate teams working on these projects with a similar core value – to create an advanced esports ecosystem and push the gaming market forward into the future. Both projects are synergetic. Moreover, partners and advisory board are completely different. Please have a look at our Whitepaper for more in-depth view on our crew structure and ICO prospects!

Please mind that the minimum investment amount for the presale is equivalent to $50,000 in ETH and BTC. The second option is to join the crowdsale on December 11-14 and get a 10% bonus on the first day of the sale. The minimum investment is just 0.1 ETH. Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Welcome the DreamTeam new Advisory Board Member - Salim Mitha, Partner at Evolution Media, the growth venture fund which resides within Creative Artists Agency. His operational and investment experience derives from launching, running and successfully exiting three separate technology start-up companies, as well as from senior roles in consulting, banking and technology. Prior to joining Evolution, Salim was the Managing Director: Search & Social Search at Yahoo where he was responsible for Social Search products. He joins the pool of experienced industry leaders and influencer that will support and structure the DreamTeam development.

Author: choojoy
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: We are glad that the project DreamTeam is constantly developing and that your team takes the remarks in the report in such a responsible way. Also, we would like to thank you for the feedback.  It should be mentioned  that the information provided in the report was relevant at the moment of its creation (03.11.2017) and, after analyzing your objections, we are ready to provide the following comments   Quote Let’s address all Digrate.com concerns one-by-one:  On the page #11, a question is asked: Does the problem the project plans to solve really exist? DreamTeam strongly believes that such a problem does really exist for 250-300M players worldwide, according to the Newzoo Global Esports Market Report. Right now no all-in-one platform offers a comprehensive list of tools and utilities to kick-start an esports career. We are faced with a multi-million audience that is stuck in development as there is no simple and effective solution that can solve their pains without spending thousands of dollars and weeks of time to establish a team and gather players of similar skill level.  The market problem, which should be solved by the project, does exist, which is confirmed by the score 5 points (out of 7 possible). In the rating committee’s opinion, a better score will not reflect the objective situation, because there is no full and exhaustive information in White Paper concerning the fundamental problems ,which also affect the industry development as well as the increase in cybersport clubs number and the ecosystem creation.  Here are some of them:  1. The interaction rules among the cybersport market players really depend on the games publishers’ policy, which makes it difficult for other market players (teams, leagues) to develop the infrastructure and ,subsequently, is the main risk for investing in the industry. 2. Juridically the publisher can always reclaim the content,where these or those game fragments are used. The influential Mass Media can purchase the rights and translations only with the authorization of the game publisher - not the leagues or multigamings. 3. The juridical base for disputes settlements among the members of the cybersport global market is missing. Also, the difference in legislation of different countries allows to interpret many cases and situations in the interaction among the cybersport industry members in a different way. Moreover, the players’ social and psychological peculiarities  may also have an impact on the market development. This aspect is worth a deeper scientific researching.   Quote On the page #14, a question is asked: Does the company understand its competition? Well, we’ve actually done a thorough analysis of DreamTeam competition. DreamTeam Crew has many years of hands-on experience in esports, and in our opinion, eSports.com and Eloplay are not our competitors by any margin. Drawing from our experience and having gathered an Advisory Board and Partners who have been working with various gaming and esports sub-industries, we are fully aware of all available options out there and how the esports industry is stagnating because of their incomprehensiveness. Our CEO, Alexander Kokhanovskyy, has 17 years of experience in the Esports industry; created one of the most popular teams in the history of Esports – Natus Vincere (Na`Vi); shareholder of ESForce, the 3rd biggest Esports entity funded by the USM Holdings. He worked his way up from an amateur player to a pro who represented his country on the international level on the world championship (World Cyber Games). Being a seasoned esports player, he utilizes all of his experience to solve actual esports problems and help it become on par with regular sports  A high score -6 points (out of 7 possible) of the criterium “competition knowledge”  shows that the DigRate rating committee agrees that DreamTeam has a rather deep understanding of its rivals.  A better score is not given because  there is no information about the development of virtual and augmented reality game segments in White Paper. They will pressure the conjuncture and influence the profit sharing among the members of the game and cybersport market . What is more, the analysis ignores the platforms that are local and are not related to the direct rivals of the project but affect the difference between supply and demand at the online games and cybersport market. It should be mentioned, that in this case we DO NOT mean the projects, which are responsible only for organizing bets on cybersport events.  As an example, here is the list of cybersport projects, which are not the direct rivals of DreamTeam. •   Eloplay (platform for holding tournaments in cybersport field, based on blockchain technologies). •   Playkey ( platform for decentralized online games streaming) •   eSports.com (platform for tactics, strategy and all the other aspects of cybersport educating, as well as the amateur and professions training and trading with real and virtual goods. •   VRCoin (platform for arranging decentralized cybersport tournaments with the win prize distribution , based on the smart contracts.   Quote On the page #17, a question is asked:  Is blockchain technology a solution to the market problem? We firmly believe that all the information available on our platform should be secure and visible to everyone, and cannot be altered. All of this can be done only through utilizing the blockchain technology and smart-contracts. This way DreamTeam can ensure that when third parties sign contracts, every participant obliges to the terms written down in it. Without the blockchain technology, smart-contracts are impossible to implement. Smart-contracts protect all the arrangements from retroactive changes. By using them on DreamTeam, we can guarantee payments of promised sums to the players and fulfillment of all undertaken obligations to the tournament organizers and sponsors. A big issue is players’ salaries and tournament prize money payouts. This is a major irritation point even for those who were able to find time, money and go through the hurdles of creating a team on their own. There is too much fraud even at the professional level, more so for the amateurs. It’s often the case that tournament prize payouts are delayed up to six months, and salaries are not paid according to contracts. DreamTeam addresses these issues and will develop a wide range of services that function using smart contracts to ensure zero fraud, timely payouts, and secure financial operations management.  For example, teams can set their KPI’s for the team manager and team coach, and they, in turn, set personal KPI’s for each player. Then, after a period of time (e.g., after a month), everyone is auto-checked by smart contracts and depending on the results, all participants of the process receive their salary and bonuses. The same goes for tournament prize payout, a smart contract is signed before the tournament start, and after the tournament and every team will immediately receive a payment according to their placement results. DreamTeam smart-contract, therefore, provide limitless opportunities for a variety of spheres. With unlocking of blockchain and smart contracts technologies, we have a unique opportunity to build one-of-a-kind platform and payment gateway for players, teams, tournaments, and sponsors.  Blockchain technology, used as a base for the DreamTeam platform, is definitely a solution to the problem of financial transactions security and the regulating of a new-generation financial ecosystem. But the project’s description doesn’t fully answer the following question:  will this blockchain technology help to reduce the role of intermediaries at the game and cybersport market, uniting all the elements of management, analytics, coaching, marketing and media instruments as well as the qualitative analysis of a large data amount. In order to introduce such platform functions as players searching and HR, game practice acquisition, tournaments arranging and organizing, creating reports for the sponsor, blockchain technology and smart contracts are not necessary.   Quote On the page #20, a question is asked: Is there already a working product that can be sold to customers? The DreamTeam Beta platform went live in October and we’ve already reached a 1 user per minute registration rate. There have been over 20,000 registrations in two weeks since the launch and players are very active in the process of creating and joining CS:GO teams on DreamTeam.  There is no doubt that today the beta-version 1.0 of the site Dreamteam.gg is in the working order but it its functions are restricted , with no special differences from the similar centralized projects of this kind.  After the realization of the  platform functions set, which is specified in White Paper, the DigRate rating committee will grant the product 6 or more points.  To be objective, it is important to say that in contrast to the rivals’ sites DreamTeam.gg has a clearer navigation and a better level of usability. On GitHub one can see a simple published smart contract in one line of code, which initializes DTT token. Smart contract introduction is to be launched at the end of 2018.  Quote On the page #24, a question is asked: Is the issuance of tokens limited? According to the Legal Token Sale Agreement found on our website the issuance of tokens is limited: “The Seller will issue the amount of DreamTeam Tokens equivalent to $45,000,000. If the Seller will not sale all issued DreamTeam Tokens during the Sale Period, then all the rest that remain will be burned out.”  DreamTeam has the first presale and sale soft cap of $2M and a hard cap of $6M. The overall cap was lowered from $75M to $45M, and all unsold tokens are burned. Therefore DreamTeam issues a limited number of tokens.  The information has been updated. As the rating committee reconsiders the criterium “limited token issue” the score can rise from 3 to 6 points. Also, it is highly desirable that DreamTeam should reveal the question about the token emission limiting not only during the period of ICO conduct but also for future periods after the platform is launched.   Quote On the page #31, a question is asked: Has the company taken preventive measures to avoid problems with ICO market regulators? As answered in the above question, we cooperate with top law firms that consult such giants as Apple, Facebook, Google, and eBay to avoid any complications with ICO market regulations. We structure our token not as a security, swap, futures or forward, but as a utility token - meaning commodity.  According to the data in the titles about the registration and juridical structure of the main company ZeroGravity LTD, the only beneficial owner and CEO is Alexander Kochanovsky. The  definition “ transparency of the project’s juridical structure” implies a wider concept and ,apart from the titles publishing, includes the following parameters of the investment attractiveness: •   there should be corporate institutes controlling the project assets usage(for example, escrow-intermediaries usage) •   the transparency in terms of owning the financial assets of the company (for instance, in the titles there is no information on the authorized capital share belonging to Vladimir Panchenko, although on site https://token.dreamteam.gg/  he is called a co-founder of the project); •   indicators of the corporate business consolidation for the financial calculations of the investment transaction basis  (for example, there are several financially differentiated business directions within one main company)   The agreement concerning the tokens sale was amended in terms of jurisprudence. The amendments are as follows: the USA citizens and residents and/or residents of the following countries and territories: the USA, South Korea,Japan, Iran, Syria, CNR, Cuba, DPRK, Abu Dhabi and the Autonomous Republic of Crimea - have no right to take part in the first phase of DTT tokens sale. Although, when the second phase takes place, they are not forbidden to purchase DTT tokens. As the rating committee reconsiders the criterium “ taking measures” , the score can be changed from 5 to 6 points.   Quote On the page #34, a question is asked: Is the project popular on social networks and in thematic communities? At this point in time, we are mostly focused on developing our platform, which is key as we want to offer the best experiences for players on a very tight schedule. According to Similarweb open data source have neared the 1M visits per month. Please follow the link https://imgur.com/a/lXQWp for Similar Web stats.  As for our social media presence, thousands of users have flocked to them already and follow DreamTeam news and weekly updates. Many more have signed up for our newsletter where we discuss the latest developments in DreamTeam. We are confident that as our platform grows more and more people will naturally flow to our social media pages to discuss latest esports news and more.  The information was updated as at the date of 19.11.2017. As the rating committee reconsiders the question, the score can be increased up to 3 points.   Quote On the page #36, a question is asked: Is the project widely discussed in blockchain news resources? DreamTeam Crew received a prestigious “Blockchain Best Industry Application Award” at the Global Fintech & Blockchain China Summit 2017 and received high praises from the Organizing Committee of the Award for the breakthrough application of blockchain and smart-contracts technologies in Esports market development. Our platform has been noted on many specialized blockchain news resources and prominent media outlets such as CoinSchedule, CoinSpeaker, Forbes and more. Please consult the below list of publications for in-depth reading.  https://www.coinschedule.com/blog/how-one-man-is-changing-the-esports-industry/ https://www.coinspeaker.com/2017/11/09/blockchain-based-dreamteam-app-aims-shake-whole-esports-industry/ https://blog.icoalert.com/ico-alert-report-dreamteam-3a84425a43f7 https://icowatchlist.com/blog/dreamteam-invest-in-esports-industry/ http://bitcoinist.com/dreamteam-creates-the-first-and-largest-recruitment-and-management-network-for-esports-players/ https://www.forbes.com/sites/outofasia/2017/11/07/how-cryptocurrencies-and-blockchain-are-taking-esports-to-the-next-level/#b0a85b543912   The information was updated as at the date of 19.11.2017. As the rating committee reconsiders the question, the score can be changed to 4 points.   Quote On the page #43, a question is asked: Does the project have a strong advisory board? We are constantly updating the list of our advisers and partners and publicize their addition to the DreamTeam Advisory Board and Partners List. Please consult our Whitepaper for the up-to-date and Medium blog for the official press-releases. We will continue to add high-level professionals and consultants from different spheres and will have the strongest Advisory Board compared to any other gaming/crypto ICO ever. As of now, the DreamTeam Board was joined by:  Moe Levin – CEO of Keynote Sundance Digiovanni – former CEO and Co-Founder of MLG, VP content and media in Blizzard Kim Rom – an Esports and gaming veteran, and former CMO at SteelSeries and Chief Gaming officer at Kinguin.  On 17. 11.2017 DreamTeam announced that the partner of Evolution Media, which comprises Creative Artists Agency, had joined the advisory board. The partner is Salim Misa. Two people who work in the advisory board (which consists of 4 people) personally confirmed their belonging to Advisory Board. As the rating committee reconsiders the issue, the score can be updated up to 6 points.    Quote On the page #44, a question is asked: Are the project’s partners large and well-known? In the last weeks, we’ve have announced several large and well-known partners that are in their essence the most significant esports entities in the world. As of now, the DreamTeam Partners are:  ESL - the world #1 Esports company and the biggest tournament organizer Starladder - one of the biggest tournament organizer, platform for amateur and semi-professional gamers Natus Vincere (Na`Vi) - one of the most popular and one of the most successful Esports teams on the planet.  On 03.11.2017 DreamTeam announced it became partners with Natus Vincere-it is a professional cybersport club, which is a world leader in the field.  As the rating committee reconsiders the question, the score can be increased up to 6 points.   Quote On the page #46, a question is asked: Is the project attracting large VC investors? This is not a relevant characteristics, and it seems the Digrate team was unable to grasp the DreamTeam investment idea fully. Our investment model does not correspond with the idea of attracting VC money. Currently, DreamTeam leadership is financing the platform development out of their own pocket. Moreover, we receive dozens of requests at conferences and even more emails and calls from people who want to buy out the DreamTeam share in the project. But we have a different financing model and have set up a dedicated token sale for all interested parties to join in December. Through the token sale, DreamTeam offers a large swath of opportunities for token buyers from all over the world who want to partake in the development of the greatest all-in-one esports platform. We are keen to ensure that the esports community isn’t passive on the issue of its development perspectives but has a vote in the creation of a uniform esports eco-system.  Venture capital attraction is not a compulsory aspect of the DreamTeam business model, but large venture investors’ support plays an important role as an image element for increasing the potential investors’ trust. The venture fund also helps its portfolio company to design a corporate structure, introduce the product to the market, to establish contacts and set up  strategic management. In the whole, the fund will help the project to increase its value for the customer as quickly as possible. Increasing the value for the customer means rocketing the capitalization, which is the  main value for the startup and investors. On 17.11.2017 DreamTeam announced that the advisory board  had been joined by the partner Evolution Media - Salim Misa.  As the rating committee reconsiders the question, the score can be increased up to 3 points.     Conclusion:  DigRate’s aim is to show all the advantages and disadvantages of the ICO conducted by DreamTeam. The date 03. 11.2017 saw the project not completely ready for carrying out ICO, which can be confirmed by the fact the pre-sale date was 25 days postponed  ( from 13, November, to 7, December) and the decrease of Overall Cap by 60% (from 75 to 45 million dollars) . DigRate believes that DreamTeam is sincere and enthusiastic enough in its attempts to avoid the previous mistakes concerning the general concept creation ,as well as the marketing and economic parts of the project. According to the update as at the date of 19.11.2017 and taking into account all the corrections the investment attractiveness rate can be increased from 4,1 points tp 4,6 points, which means the rate is B1-Considerable risk exposure, high sensitivity to market conditions.

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: WEBSITE | WHITEPAPER | ONE PAGER | VIDEO  DreamTeam - Infrastructure platform and payment gateway for Esports and Gaming. With the unlocking of blockchain and smart-contracts technologies, we have a unique opportunity to build a one-of-a-kind platform, and payment gateway for players, teams, tournaments and sponsors.  Big Idea  Since the beginning of mankind, we have been living in endless competition. It’s always about being faster, better, stronger. And today it’s about becoming #1 on a gaming server! Imagine that 1.4 Bn players are registered in just Top 10 competitive titles, and eight of them are team-based games like Counter-Strike, League of Legends, Dota2 and Overwatch, all played 5x5 or 6x6. But while it’s easy to have fun playing solo, it becomes really tough for players who want to form a team and start an amateur career. But how would you look for a job without recruitment websites or grow a company with no management tools? Or just picture communicating without e-mail and hiring staff without CVs... Sounds unrealistic? Well, that’s the reality for 250M players who want to build, grow and manage their teams! With the unlocking of blockchain & smart contract technologies, we have a unique opportunity to provide an all-in-one solution and build a multi-billion dollar economy on one platform. Introducing DreamTeam – the first e-sports and gaming recruitment and management network!  Problems and Solutions     There are very few Esports clubs due to the extremely hard conditions for team creation and management. As an example, there are 300M soccer players compared to 250M Esports LOL players. But there are 300,000 soccer clubs, and only around 100 Esports LOL clubs. Presently to create a team, you must open a bank account, set up a legal entity and make monthly payments. It takes a lot of time and efforts. To ensure basic functioning of the team, you need to hire an accountant and a lawyer at least. You must prepare all of the necessary documents on your own, including contracts for players, sponsors, and other staff. You have to use dozens of different services for scouting, recruitment, management, etc. No all-in-one solution. The cost to create a team starts from $3,000 and $400+ to support it monthly. The timeframe is at least 1-2 months on average.     While the traditional sports market is by far one of the largest markets with a 2.8Bn audience and $150Bn in revenue, its very slow growth seems to have hit a ceiling. The sports market is highly regulated and its growth rate is not like it used to be 10-20 years ago, as we are immersing further and further into the virtual gaming world. And esports has all the prerequisites to become the biggest sport on the planet.  Competitive gaming as a major part of the gaming industry     The core of competitive gaming and a large part of the gaming market is in competition between players or teams in the online multiplayer games. Remember that 1.5 Bn users are registered in the top-10 competitive titles on PC alone, and the revenue of such games equals to about 45% of the entire PC gaming market revenue, around $11Bn. Eight out of ten titles are team-based games like Counter-Strike, League of Legends, DotA 2, World of Tanks and Overwatch, all played 5-on-5 or 6-on-6.     Company Highlights  DreamTeam launched its Beta version of the platform in late October 2017 and by the end of 2018 we expect at least 4M user registrations spread out across CS:GO, LoL, PUBG and other titles supported by our platform. The vast majority of users come from the US, Europe and CIS regions. Regarding the DreamTeam ICO, Phase #1 reached its hard cap of $6M in December 2017. And Phase #2 of the DreamTeam Token Sale that will take place in April-May 2018 is expected to gather an additional $38M to reach our overall goal of $45M in investments.     DreamTeam Token Sale Essentials  Token Sale Phase #2 Dates. The Presale will take place on April 12–18, 2018 with the Sale starting on April 19 and going through Mays 19, 2018. For more information please have a look at our official press release on Medium: http://bit.ly/2ESisXW  Tokens can be used within the DreamTeam platform, in trading at stock exchanges and by third-party services and platforms. For token sale, DreamTeam token uses Ethereum erc20 token standard. In 2018 all tokens will be exchanged at 1=1 ratio for the more convenient platform – Eos / Tezos / Waves or our own platform. Token issue – 30 days after the end of Token Sale with their subsequent placement on users` wallets within the platform. Standard KYC and AML rules apply.     The DreamTeam Crew guarantees a transparent and clear-cut use of raised funds that will go towards Product Development (44%), Operations (17%), and Marketing efforts (39%). The same is true for the DreamTeam Tokens distribution that is divided into the Token Sale (60%), Bonuses for Teams and Tournament Organizers (15%), Team and Early Investors (10%), DreamTeam Reserve (10%), and Advisory Board and Partners Compensation (5%).  For more in-depth information visit DreamTeam at https://token.dreamteam.gg/ Follow us on our social media channels:  Telegram ENG https://t.me/joinchat/GIoVA0I_pcrmSR4b0mztOw Telegram RU https://t.me/joinchat/GIoVA0QpKRJOmc1CxJNqGQ Facebook https://www.facebook.com/DreamTeam.Token LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/25024462/ Twitter https://twitter.com/DreamTeam_Token Reddit https://www.reddit.com/user/dream-team-gg Slack https://dreamteamtoken.slack.com Bitcointalk https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=1102723;sa=forumProfile VK https://vk.com/dreamteamtoken

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: DMarket is a separate project from DreamTeam which is being developed and led by a separate team. DreamTeam is working full time on our project development. We put maximum effort in order to achieve the goals set on the roadmap. Both DMarket and DreamTeam are led by professionals with a lot of experience on the market and since we set our reputation at stake, there is no way of stepping back. DMarket has their own support and if you have any questions regarding their project, you are always welcome to contact them.  Alexandr Khohanovsky is the minor shareholder and Board Member in DMarket project. His core goals are networking and strategic project development. He is NOT invovled in any daily DMarket operations. The same applies for Volodymyr Panchenko - he's the minor shareholder + Board Member in DreamTeam. He's taking care of strategic planning + advising on Machine learning and AI: he succesfully used both in his previous projects. Teams are completely separated. The one and only person involved in both (for now) products is Andriy Khavruchenko. DreamTeam will provide a significant boost for DMarket in terms of users, transactions, etc. and vice versa. We already discussing going live and revealing those features to the public. Both projects got amazing synergy together!  Moreover, guys are going to have a special Q&A session in a few days and will answer all of the questions!

Author: Krezz2017
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Perhaps the project and the good, it is difficult to understand. But, a question. Where will you get 2.5 million players? There are many similar platforms. What will you lure?

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: Hi! Thank you for your question.  Our actual goal is getting at least 4 MLN active users on our platform. There are over 250 MLN players behind the most popular competitive titles. With this said, our goal is to gain 4 MLN users by the end of 2018 is absolutely real. Though it might look like our competitors provide similar services, there are no other projects like ours. We are not creating "just helpful tools", but we are building the ecosystem with a bunch of great solutions. We’re constantly studying the market, and we can assure you that our services are comprehensive and top-notch. We have a detailed user acquisition strategy that includes cooperation with tournaments and pro-teams, sponsorship opportunities and much more. A quality and safe service with professional and helpful management tools, as well as coaching and marketing features - that’s exactly what we want to offer to all the players around the globe. Some of our employees have been in the industry for over a decade now, they are among the pioneers and the ones who shaped it from the very beginning.  Thank you for your attention to our project! Stay in touch for our upcoming announcements!

Author: DreamTeamGG
Title: [ANN][ICO] DreamTeam - the first Esports recruitment and management platform
Body: DreamTeam is proud to announce the addition of Mustafa Seyrek as the new DreamTeam CTO. Having worked at Sony Entertainment (Los-Angeles, USA) on Crackle as the Director of Engineering and being an experienced software leader with over 20 years’ experience in multiple industries including wireless, finance, e-commerce, manufacturing, entertainment, and media, Mustafa will be playing a crucial role in the DreamTeam development. Follow the link for full press release: http://bit.ly/2yJ2xIc
